body: We are working on this issue at [Softwerkskammer Ruhrgebiet Hackergarten](https://www.meetup.com/Softwerkskammer-Ruhrgebiet/events/248952817/)
We will probably use AbstractCharSequenceAssert instead.

issue.title: Feature/1319

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
Add size related assertions for CharSequences:

- hasSizeLessThan
- hasSizeLessThanOrEqualTo
- hasSizeGreaterThan
- hasSizeGreaterThanOrEqualTo

pair programmed with @sparsick

#### Check List:
* Fixes #1319
* Unit tests : YES
* Javadoc with a code example (API only) : YES

body:
Hi @georgberky 
I guess, I'm a bit late with this but you might want to take a look at this PR:
https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/pull/1285

This implements most of these methods and not just for String but for all iterables.

@joel-costigliola: any chance that you can review my PR? I know it's a huge one...
@martin-tarjanyi I will to but it's huge.

@martin-tarjanyi you're right, this slipped out of my mind, I will review it to but it's huge so I haven't got the mental energy to do it yet (I'll take care of merging/rebasing on master after this PR is merged).
@martin-tarjanyi Strings are not iterable in Java, so that I think it will not have conflict with your pull request.
@martin-tarjanyi oh I see. Thank you for clarifying.
